00111 static double Ln02(const double& time_n_plus_1, const double& time_n, const double& time_n_minus_1, const double& time_n_minus_2)
00112 {
00113 // Integration of first degree-2 lagrangian polynomial with Simpson's formulae
00114 // Ln02(time_n_minus_2) = 0
00115 // Ln02(time_n_minus_1) = 0
00116 // Ln02(time_n)         = 1
00117 // Integration bound : time_n and time_n_plus_1
00118   double result = 0.;
00119 
00120   double midpoint = (time_n_plus_1+time_n);
00121   midpoint *= 0.5;
00122 
00123   double scaling_coeff = (time_n_plus_1-time_n);
00124   scaling_coeff /= 6.;
00125 
00126   double denominator = (time_n-time_n_minus_1);
00127   denominator *= (time_n-time_n_minus_2);
00128   denominator = 1./denominator;
00129 
00130   double numerator = (time_n-time_n_minus_1)*(time_n-time_n_minus_2);
00131   numerator += 4*(midpoint-time_n_minus_1)*(midpoint-time_n_minus_2);
00132   numerator += (time_n_plus_1-time_n_minus_1)*(time_n_plus_1-time_n_minus_2);
00133 
00134   result = scaling_coeff * numerator * denominator;
00135   return result;
00136 }
00137 
00138 static double Ln12(const double& time_n_plus_1, const double& time_n, const double& time_n_minus_1, const double& time_n_minus_2)
00139 {
00140 // Integration of second degree-2 lagrangian polynomial with Simpson's formulae
00141 // Ln12(time_n_minus_2) = 0
00142 // Ln12(time_n_minus_1) = 1
00143 // Ln12(time_n)         = 0
00144 // Integration bound : time_n and time_n_plus_1
00145   double result = 0.;
00146 
00147   double midpoint = (time_n_plus_1+time_n);
00148   midpoint *= 0.5;
00149 
00150   double scaling_coeff = (time_n_plus_1-time_n);
00151   scaling_coeff /= 6.;
00152 
00153   double denominator = (time_n_minus_1-time_n);
00154   denominator *= (time_n_minus_1-time_n_minus_2);
00155   denominator = 1./denominator;
00156 
00157   double numerator = 0.;
00158   numerator += 4*(midpoint-time_n)*(midpoint-time_n_minus_2);
00159   numerator += (time_n_plus_1-time_n)*(time_n_plus_1-time_n_minus_2);
00160 
00161   result = scaling_coeff * numerator * denominator;
00162   return result;
00163 }
00164 
00165 void Schema_Adams_Bashforth_order_3::compute_adams_bashforth_coefficients(double time_step, const DoubleTab& times)
00166 {
00167   if (nb_pas_dt()<100 && limpr() && facteur_securite_pas()==1.0)
00168     {
00169       Cerr << finl;
00170       Cerr << "********************* Warning (printed only on the first 100 time steps) **********************"<< finl;
00171       Cerr << "The Adams Bashforth order 3 scheme is recommended with a facsec lower than 1.0 for example 0.5."<< finl;
00172       Cerr << "***********************************************************************************************"<< finl;
00173 // See $TRUST_ROOT/tests/Reference/Schema_Adams_Bashforth_order_3 test case.
00174     }
00175 
00176   assert(times.size_array() == 4); //2 past times, present and future times, stored in ascending order inside "times" table
00177 
00178   if (coefficients().size_array() != 3)
00179     {
00180       coefficients().resize(3,Array_base::NOCOPY_NOINIT);
00181     }
00182 
00183   double inv_time_step  = 1./time_step;
00184   double time_n_minus_2 = times[0];
00185   double time_n_minus_1 = times[1];
00186   double time_n         = times[2];
00187   double time_n_plus_1  = times[3];
00188 
00189   coefficients()[2] = Ln02(time_n_plus_1,time_n,time_n_minus_1,time_n_minus_2) * inv_time_step;
00190   coefficients()[1] = Ln12(time_n_plus_1,time_n,time_n_minus_1,time_n_minus_2) * inv_time_step;
00191   coefficients()[0] = 1-coefficients()[2]-coefficients()[1];
00192 }
